unDef.description: The interaction between multiple GQL-environments within the constraints of GQL-transaction semantics.
Whether or not diagnostic information pertaining to more than one condition is made available.
Whether or not that exception condition is actually raised when the evaluation of an inessential part of an expression or search condition would cause an exception to be raised.
Which path bindings are retained in an any paths search if the number of candidates exceeds the required number.
Which additional path bindings are actually probed to establish whether they might also raise an exception when the GQL-implementation has terminated the evaluation of a selective path pattern.

Whether or not a rollback is forced when a GQL-transaction becomes blocked, cannot complete without causing semantic inconsistency, or the resources required to continue its execution become unavailable.
The sequence of records in an unordered binding table.
The order of path bindings that have the same number of edges.
The relative ordering of peers in a sort.
The relative ordering of items in a sort whose comparison is Unknown.
The actual order of expression evaluation.
The point in time at which the request timestamp is set.
The value of an object identifier.
The ‹value expression› whose evaluation raises the exception condition: “data exception — invalid value type (22G12)”.
The value value returned by an evaluation of the ELEMENT_ID function.
The physical representation of an instance of a data type.
The declared type of a site that contains an intermediate result.
Which arbitrary value is chosen when multiple assignments to a graph element property are specified.
The start datetime used for converting intervals to scalars for subtraction purposes.
The mechanism for determining which exception condition is to be returned as the primary GQL-status object of an execution outcome from a set of raised exception conditions.
